action.action-desc: Mr. Bera introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To ensure access to cost-free rabies postexposure prophylaxis.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Affordable Rabies Treatment for All Act of 2023.

section.header: Requiring the Secretary of Health and Human Services to establish a program to reimburse health care providers for furnishing rabies postexposure prophylaxis and related services to uninsured individuals

subsection.text: The Secretary of Health and Human Services shall establish a program under which—

paragraph.text: program-registered providers submit claims to the Secretary with respect to the furnishing of medically necessary rabies postexposure prohylaxis and related items and services (as defined in subsection (b)) to uninsured individuals; and
the Secretary, subject to the availability of appropriations, pays each such provider for such prohylaxis and related items and services in an amount determined appropriate by the Secretary.
The term program-registered provider means a health care provider that—

subparagraph.text: is licensed or otherwise authorized to furnish rabies postexposure prohylaxis and related items and services in the State in which such provider furnishes such prophylaxis and related items and services under the program established under this section; and
enters into an agreement with the Secretary under which the provider agrees—

clause.text: not to hold an uninsured individual liable for the cost of rabies postexposure prophylaxis or related items and services with respect to which a payment is made under subsection (a)(2); and

to limit any charge to such individual for the administration of such prophylaxis or related items and services with respect to which such a payment is so made to an amount specified by the Secretary.

paragraph.header: Rabies postexposure prohylaxis; related items and services
paragraph.text: The terms rabies postexposure prophylaxis and related items and services have the meaning given such terms in section 2713 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300gg–13).
The term Secretary means the Secretary of Health and Human Services.
The term uninsured individual means, with respect to an individual furnished rabies postexposure prohylaxis, an individual who is not enrolled in—

subparagraph.text: a Federal health care program (as defined in section 1128B(f) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1320a–7b(f)));

a group health plan or health insurance coverage offered by a health insurance issuer in the group or individual market (as such terms are defined in section 2791 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300gg–91)); or
a health plan offered under chapter 89 of title 5, United States Code.

section.header: Ensuring no-cost coverage of rabies postexposure prophylaxis and related items and services for insured individuals

paragraph.text: Section 2713 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300gg–13) is amended—

clause.text: in paragraph (2), by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (3), by striking the period and inserting a semicolon;
in paragraph (4), by striking the period and inserting a semicolon;
by redesignating paragraph (5) as paragraph (6); and
by inserting after paragraph (4) the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: rabies postexposure prohylaxis and related items and services; and

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: The term rabies postexposure prophylaxis means human rabies immune globulin and rabies vaccine doses, or any other treatment specified by the Secretary, furnished in accordance with guidelines specified by the Secretary to an individual who has been potentially exposed to the rabies virus to prevent the occurrence of rabies.

The term related items and services means items and services furnished to an individual during health care provider office visits (which term in this paragraph includes in-person visits and telehealth visits), urgent care center visits, and emergency room visits that result in an order for or administration of rabies postexposure prophylaxis described in paragraph (2), but only to the extent such items and services relate to the furnishing or administration of such prophylaxis or to the evaluation of such individual for purposes of determining the need of such individual for such prophylaxis.
The amendments made by this subsection shall apply with respect to plan years beginning on or after the date that is 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act.
Section 1833 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395l) is amended—

clause.text: in subparagraph (GG), by striking and at the end; and

by inserting before the semicolon at the end the following , and (II) with respect to rabies postexposure prohylaxis and related items and services (as such terms are defined in section 2713 of the Public Health Service Act), the amounts paid shall be equal to 100 percent of the lesser of the actual charge for such prohylaxis, items, and services, or the amount otherwise payable for such prohylaxis, items, and services under this part; and
in paragraph (12), by string , and at the end; and
in paragraph (13), by striking .. at the end and inserting , and (14) such deductible shall not apply with respect to rabies postexposure prophylaxis and related items and services..

paragraph.text: The amendments made by this subsection shall apply with respect to items and services furnished on or after the first day of the first calendar year beginning on or after the date that is 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Grants to local health departments to stockpile rabies postexposure prophylaxis
section.text: Part P of title III of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 380g et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Grants to local health departments to stockpile rabies postexposure prophylaxis

subsection.text: The Secretary may award grants to local health departments to—

paragraph.text: establish and maintain a stockpile of—

subparagraph.text: items that are related items and services; and

paragraph.text: furnish rabies postexposure prohylaxis and related items and services.

subsection.text: In this section, the terms rabies postexposure prophylaxis and related items and services have the meanings given such terms in section 2713.
